parameters:
\N<Luda Soldier>This is a facility managed by us Luda. It is not a place
where you can freely enter.
weather : 0 : 5 : 5 : 15 : 1 : Light_01D : 1
weather : 1 : 5 : 5 : 5 : 1 : Light_01C : 1
air05
air08
<ActiveMessage:\C[1]■Event■>
\N<Segi>Um...
\N<Luda Soldier>Hm? What do you want? What's a woman like you doing here?

\N<Segi>Well... I came here to request permission to enter the
training facility ahead.
\N<Luda Soldier>The training facility? You?
\N<Segi>...Yes.

\N<Luda Soldier>Hahaha, come on, you're joking, right? A place like this
isn't for a woman like you to just waltz into. Do you
understand what you're asking? Huh, missy?
\N<Segi>...Of course. I'm not asking as a joke or on a whim.
\N<Luda Soldier>Oh...?
\N<Segi>...

\N<Luda Soldier>Hmph... I see, so you're serious after all. But
unfortunately, without official permission, you can't
proceed any further.

\N<Luda Soldier>Besides, such permission is only granted to warriors
participating in the training assembly. You might as well
give up and turn back.

\N<Segi>I am a warrior candidate for that training assembly. I
believe I have the right to enter.
\N<Luda Soldier>A warrior candidate for the training assembly? You?

\N<Segi>Yes, is there something suspicious about that? I've heard of
women participating before.

\N<Segi>Besides... I was informed that this is merely an assessment
training facility. Therefore, I thought even someone like me
could manage it.
\N<Luda Soldier>...
\N<Segi>...

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh... Alright, fine. But make sure you don't end up
regretting it.
\N<Segi>...Thank you for your advice.

\N<Luda Soldier>One thing before you enter. Are you aware of the protective
measures required to enter the training facility ahead?
\N<Segi>Protective measures...?

\N<Luda Soldier>That's right. There's a toxic miasma inside the ruins that's
harmful to the human body. You can't just waltz in there
unprotected.

\N<Segi>(Rozaro mentioned... there's a way to avoid the ruins' toxic
miasma using Luda technology. This must be what he was
talking about.)

\N<Luda Soldier>The place ahead is indeed an assessment training facility,
but it's still part of the ruins. In other words, it's a
dangerous place filled with toxic miasma.

\N<Luda Soldier>So... as a measure against that, you'll need to take this
just like everyone else.
NE_薬1
\N<Segi>This is...

\N<Luda Soldier>Didn't I tell you? It's an antidote to prevent contamination
from the toxic miasma. That's the protective measure.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Luda Soldier>What's wrong? Something bothering you? You're free to doubt,
but if you step inside the ruins without taking this, you'll
definitely be on your way to the next world because of the
miasma.

\N<Luda Soldier>Of course, whether you drink it or not is up to you, but we
can't let anyone who hasn't taken precautions enter the
ruins. Makes sense, right?
\N<Segi>...
\N<Segi>...Understood. I'll take it.

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh, well that's the obvious choice, isn't it? Once you go
inside, you'll understand what I mean firsthand.
\N<Segi>...Is this alright?

\N<Luda Soldier>Yeah, but just because you've taken the antidote doesn't
mean it's safe inside, got it?
\N<Segi>...I intend to be cautious.

\N<Luda Soldier>Is that so? Use the elevator at the back and you'll reach
the ruins right away. Take care now.

\N<Luda Soldier>Whoa there, this area is off-limits. You need special
permission to enter the underwater ruins.

\N<Man>There are still many areas within the ruins that remain
unexplored. If we search every nook and cranny, we might
discover some useful items.
